title.narrative: Assistance alimentaire d’urgence et appui à la restauration rapide des moyens de subsistance des ménages en IPC 4 Urgence et IPC 3 Crise suite à l’impact de l’El niño dans le Sud de Madagascar

description.narrative: The overall objective of this project is to provide emergency food assistance in the form of cash transfers to households affected by the drought and support the emergency rehabilitation of livelihoods in the Grand South of Madagascar. The project plans to distribute 30 tons of sorghum, 36.6 tons of beans, 10 tons of cowpea and 40 000 bags of vegetable seeds. In total, 126,800 people will benefit from this nine-month project.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Assistance alimentaire d’urgence et appui à la restauration rapide des moyens de subsistance des ménages en IPC 4 Urgence et IPC 3 Crise suite à l’impact de l’El niño dans le Sud de Madagascar

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS MADAGASCAR UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES DROUGHT 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
